node.title: Biden's power temporarily transferred to Harris during colonoscopy
node.description: The transfer of power lasted one hour and 25 minutes.

node.title: Jazz at Lincoln Center Reopens, With Four Young Players in the Spotlight
node.description: The Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra returned to indoor performance with “Wynton at 60,” a program featuring Marsalis originals and a quartet of up-and-coming trumpeters.

node.title: Biden Briefly Transferred Power to Harris During Medical Procedure
node.description: President Biden, who will undergo a physical and colonoscopy on Friday, is the oldest commander in chief to receive a full medical evaluation while in office.

node.title: When Is the Next Lunar Eclipse and When Is the Next Blood Moon?
node.description: People who missed the lunar eclipse in the early hours of Friday may be able to catch another one next year.

node.title: Kremlin Slams U.S. Bid Not to Recognize 'Autocrat' Vladimir Putin as President after 2024
node.description: Reps. Steve Cohen and Joe Wilson introduced a resolution calling on Congress not to recognize Putin if he stays in power past May 7, 2024.

node.title: Rare Print of U.S. Constitution Sells for $43M, Shatters Record Set By da Vinci Book
node.description: The anonymous user outbid a collective of 17,000 cryptocurrency investors during the auction. The document is one of only 13 known copies of the Constitution.

node.title: Tennessee Lawmakers Were Warned COVID Bill Violated Federal Law Hours Before Floor Vote
node.description: Legal counsel to Tennessee Governor Bill Lee warned lawmakers that their new bill against COVID restrictions, now signed into law, was in violation of the ADA.

node.title: If Aucklanders can holiday here, why not Australians? - South Island mayor
node.description: A South Island mayor wants the trans-Tasman bubble re-inflated, saying Aucklanders pose a similar Covid-19 risk to Australian travellers.

node.title: Recipe: Bartolini's Bolognese Ragu
node.description: The popular Italian restaurant on Chicago's South Side offers "Sunday Morning" viewers their recipe for a tempting pasta sauce.

node.title: "Sunday Morning" 2021 "Food Issue" recipe index
node.description: Delicious menu suggestions from top chefs and mixologists, cookbook authors, food writers, restaurateurs, and the editors of New York Times Cooking.

node.title: House passes Build Back Better bill after overnight delay
node.description: The passage comes after House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy broke an eight-hour, six-minute floor speech record set by Nancy Pelosi.

node.title: College basketball player praised for cleaning up after game
node.description: "We just want to say thank you for leading and showing us that there are still folks out there who recognize the hard work that's done around here," the facility's director said.

node.title: A Socialite Invented This Quintessential Cuban Sandwich
node.description: The sandwich, named after Elena Ruz, melds sweet and savory, using soft medianoche bread, white turkey meat, softened cream cheese and strawberry preserves.

node.title: Earl Sweatshirt Exhibits His Evolution, and 14 More New Songs
node.description: Hear tracks by FKA twigs, Makaya McCraven, Hazel English and others.

node.title: How H.G. Wells Predicted the 20th Century
node.description: Charles Johnson reviews Claire Tomalin’s latest biography, “The Young H.G. Wells: Changing the World.”

node.title: Curry’s 3-Point Bonanza Has Golden State Bouncing Back
node.description: A turnaround early this season has come with Curry reasserting why he is the best 3-point shooter in basketball history.

node.title: The First Family of New Jersey Football
node.description: Seventeen of the last 20 New Jersey state high school championships have featured a team coached by Mike Campanile or one of his four sons.

node.title: Transfer Rumors From Another World
node.description: Talk about stars headed to Barcelona and Real Madrid conveniently leaves out an important fact: Neither club can afford them at the moment.

node.title: Wonking Out: Going Beyond the Inflation Headlines
node.description: This isn’t the inflation you were looking for.

node.title: Review: Stephen Petronio Looks to the NYC of His Past for Inspiration
node.description: The choreographer returns to the East Village — and La MaMa — with “Petronio Punk Picks and Other Delights,” landing in a place of nostalgia.

node.title: Painful Changes in Society Eased Passage of Bold Safety Net Measure
node.description: President Barack Obama barely muscled his health law through the House. But income inequality, economic stagnation and a pandemic propelled an even more ambitious bill.

node.title: 'Cute' Freckle on Woman's Face Turns Out to Be 'Highly Aggressive' Cancer
node.description: After receiving the diagnosis, KayIa Mailer said she "sobbed" in her bathroom and "had constant anxiety about dying."

node.title: Vets Warn Owners of Dogs Getting High on Cannabis After Eating Feces
node.description: Dogs who ingest the active cannabis ingredient THC can fall ill, according to scientists who looked at records from four animal hospitals in the Australian city of Melbourne

node.title: Church Leader Allegedly Threatened Women With 'Eternal Damnation' to Coerce Into Sex
node.description: Apollo Carreon Quiboloy, head of Kingdom of Jesus Christ church, is charged with threatening women and girls who worked for him into sex.

node.title: With U.S. at Odds, Islamic Republics Iran and Pakistan Forge New Ties
node.description: "Iran and Pakistan have many common goals in the region and the Islamic world, from peace and stability in the region, including Afghanistan," Iran embassy in Pakistan spokesperson Hamaneh Karimi-Kia told Newsweek.

node.title: Woman Shares Misogynistic Comments She Received Over Outfit After 'Shark Tank' Appearance
node.description: "When you air on shark tank and learn misogyny in business is ALIVE and kicking!" the text reads on Sabeena Ladha's TikTok video.

node.title: Cost Estimate Cleared Way for House to Pass Build Back Better, but Senate Obstacles Remain
node.description: "It's a hell of a deal," Democratic Representative John Yarmuth said about the legislation, a key part of President Joe Biden's economic agenda.

node.title: 'Smallpox' Vials Found in Pennsylvania Facility's Freezer Did Not Contain Virus: CDC
node.description: The CDC found that the vials contain "vaccinia, the virus used in smallpox vaccine," rather than the variola virus that can cause infection.

node.title: Biden vaccine rule faces stiff legal challenge, experts say
node.description: As an appeals court prepares to review the OSHA order, lawyers say the government's case is anything but airtight.

node.title: Stunning images of longest partial lunar eclipse in centuries
node.description: The longest partial lunar eclipse in nearly 600 years was visible on Friday.

node.title: What to Cook This Weekend
node.description: Amid your Thanksgiving and Hanukkah planning, remember to cook for yourself.

node.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
node.description: This month’s picks include a Polish procedural, a Kazakh dark comedy, a Tunisian social-realist drama, and more.

node.title: Toyin Ojih Odutola’s Mesmeric Alternate Universes
node.description: With her richly detailed narrative drawings, the artist creates vivid fictional worlds that ask questions about our own, and about the nature of storytelling itself.

node.title: Discussions of Race Are Notably Absent in Trial of Arbery Murder Suspects
node.description: Many outside observers say Ahmaud Arbery’s death at the hands of three white men is a prominent example of racial violence. But the jury never heard that argument.

node.title: Bettina Plevan, Litigator Who Shattered Glass Ceilings, Dies at 75
node.description: After her own meteoric rise to partner at Proskauer Rose, where she handled sexual harassment cases, she helped other women advance in the legal profession.

node.title: Canada approves the Pfizer vaccine for children ages 5 to 11.
node.description: The move adds more than 2.8 million young people to those eligible for a shot.

node.title: Amateur Astronomer Discovers New Dwarf Galaxy 3 Million Light Years Away
node.description: Scientists are now trying to learn more about the galaxy, named Pisces VII/Triangulum III, which has been described as a significant discovery.
